our-monk-desc: Venerable Kalyanapura Mangala Thero has been living in South Korea for almost 15 years. He is a graduate of the University of Kelaniya. After completing the Korean language course at Widok University in South Korea in 2010, he obtained a Bachelor of Arts and a Master of Arts in Buddhist Culture and graduated from the university in 2016. He has also built a temple in the Daegu area for Sri Lankans who left the university in 2016. He has written several books on the Korean language for children studying the Korean language and is conducting lectures using videos related to the Korean language. He has also been working as a registered educational interpreter with the Korean government for several years. He was also named as a Sri Lankan guide for the Korean National Parks in 2025.
our-monk-desc2: He has also received the highest awards from the Parliament, the City Council and the South Korean Police in recognition of his service not only to Sri Lankans but also to Korean society.

pp-p1: We are committed to protecting your personal information (PII) and maintaining your privacy and security. This privacy policy explains how we collect, use, and safeguard your information.
pp-p2: We are responsible for personal information under our control. We have designated individuals to ensure compliance with this privacy policy.
pp-p3: When collecting personal information, we will clearly identify the purposes for which it is being collected. Additional purposes may be added with your consent.
pp-p4: We will obtain your consent when collecting, using, or disclosing your personal information. You may withdraw your consent at any time, subject to legal or contractual restrictions.
pp-p5: We will collect only the Personal Information necessary for identified purposes. With your consent, information may be collected through in-person interactions, phone, mail, fax, or online communication.
pp-p6: We will use or disclose Personal Information only for the purposes for which it was collected, unless otherwise authorized by you or required by law. Information will be retained only as long as necessary to fulfill those purposes or comply with legal requirements.
pp-p7: We strive to keep Personal Information accurate, complete, and up-to-date as required for the purposes for which it is used.
pp-p8: We protect Personal Information with appropriate security measures based on its sensitivity. We take reasonable precautions to prevent loss, misuse, or unauthorized access. In response to user feedback, we may block accounts when appropriate.
pp-note1: Note: Once phone numbers are shared between service providers and consumers, we cannot control subsequent interactions. We disclaim responsibility for any issues arising thereafter. However, we may review complaints and take precautionary action such as blacklisting offending parties.
pp-p9: We will make information about our privacy practices available to you upon request.
pp-p10: Upon request, you will be informed of the existence, use, and disclosure of your Personal Information and given access to it. You may request corrections if appropriate. In some cases, we may not be able to disclose certain information due to legal or proprietary constraints.

pp-p12: We may use cookies to enhance website functionality and provide a personalized user experience. Most browsers accept cookies by default, but you may adjust your settings to decline them. Note that disabling cookies may affect website performance.
pp-p13: Our website may link to third-party sites that are not governed by this policy. We recommend reviewing their privacy policies to understand how they handle your information.
